title: Why are tunnels in arch shape? - Quora

response.answer_text: Arch shaped tunnels are not really arch shaped. They are circular shaped, but 20 to 25 of them will be used for utility purpose. The reason for circular shape is.. TBM machine is in circular shape. The mosy convenient and quick way for tunnel construction. Other shape requires manual erection alot.The pressure created by the surrounding soil will be distributed equally on all the sides, where is in square or rectangle, the soil pressure will vary. This helps to withstand the soil pressure easily.
Because tunnels must withstand tremendous pressure from all sides, the arch is an ideal shape. In the case of a tunnel, the arch simply goes all the way around. Check out this link… How Tunnels Work

Circle has the least surface area among all structure .Let's take an example :-if we have to build 50 square meter shape with least surface area , then it will be a sphere . So arch shape tunnel will always have least constructional cost(as surface area is least) .
